result.execSummary:
The defendant Angel R Suarez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Angel R Suarez is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Angel R Suarez was found guilty of Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Angel R Suarez was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Angel R Suarez was found guilty of Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).
  • Angel R Suarez was found guilty of Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.
  • Angel R Suarez was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay restitution as requested in case 14CF3977 in the amount of $2,250.00 to Adam K. This amount to be paid FIRST. Pay restitution as requested in case 14CF3977 in the amount of $475.00 to Justice Point. This amount to be paid SECOND.

EACH COUNT:  Pay all costs, fees and surcharges. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Provide DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge on COUNT 1. Court WAIVED DNA surcharges on COUNTS 3, 4, 5 & 6 as they are part of a continuous course of conduct; Any bail on deposit to apply towards restitution, costs, fees and surcharges. Court costs, fees, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds/earnings.

Consecutive to: consecutive to COUNTS 3, 5, & 6, concurrent with COUNT 4, with credit for 218 days time served.
**04-22-16/JOC amended to reflect 340 days sentence credit as to counts 1 & 4

superMiscConds.notes: Maintain at least 30 hours per week of verifiable employment, or educational programming, or a combination of both.

Maintain absolute sobriety from all illegal drugs.
No contact with the victims as listed in case 14CF3977 or witnesses.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: consecutive to COUNTS 3, 5, & 6, concurrent with COUNT 1, with credit for 218 days time served.

charges.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

Order Amending Judgment of Conviction received, signed, and filed with court.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jeffrey A. Wagner, Br. 38, calendar successor, for review. spc
Letter from DOC requesting review of defendant's sentence credit.

cf
Letters on behalf of the defendant and letter from the defendant received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Victim Impact Statement with attached restitution worksheets received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
PSI received and filed. Parties notified. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

AS TO COUNTS 1, 3, 4, 5, 6:
Defendant sworn, and advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
AS TO COUNT 2:
On motion of the State, Court ordered count dismissed.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department. PSI was ordered.

Branch 25 for branch 35. Defendant Angel R Suarez in court with attorney Joseph Edward Schubert.  Defendant Angel R Suarez in custody.  Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. In-chambers discussion regarding jury instructions, witnesses, and proceedings held and then placed on the record. Court asked deputies to confiscate phones from women in the gallery. Parties prepared to proceed to trial. State's offer put on the record. Case passed to the afternoon session.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Br. 35 will be proceeding to trial in another matter, matter spun to Br. 25.

Defendant Angel R Suarez in court with attorney Joseph Edward Schubert.  Defendant Angel R Suarez in custody.  Denis John Stingl for Hanna Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requested adjournment of jury trial on last date. Defendant DOES NOT waive speedy trial demand. Matter is rescheduled on original trial date. 1/4/16 jury trial date is vacated.  Jury trial scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Clerk contacts Attorney Schumbert. Defense entered speedy trial demand on 7/24/15. Counsel requested trial date be rescheduled, speedy trial demand was not addressed. Matter is scheduled for status conference on 9/30/15 at 8:30am in Br. 35. Defendant to be produced.

Attorney Joseph Edward Schubert in court, defendant Angel R Suarez not in court, in custody.  Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 9/28/15 final pretrial date is removed from the calendar. 10/12/15 jury trial date is converted to final pretrial date.  Jury trial scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Joseph Edward Schubert in court, defendant Angel R Suarez not in court, in custody.  Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Status conference scheduled for September 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Angel R Suarez in court with attorney Joseph Edward Schubert.  Defendant Angel R Suarez in custody.  Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court grants state's joinder motion.   Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.  Case adjourned for final pretrial on 9.28.15 and for jury trial on 10.12.15.  Status conference scheduled for 08-19-2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant's Memorandum in Opposition to Joinder.
State's Motion for Joinder.

Defendant Angel R Suarez in court with attorney Joseph Edward Schubert.  Defendant Angel R Suarez in custody.  Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
BAIL AND ALL BAIL CONDITIONS REMAIN.   Court ordered case adjourned for motion hearing in Branch 7.  Motion hearing scheduled for 07-24-2015 at 08:30 am.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of PRELIMINARY HEARING commencing 05/14/205 received and filed. (17 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to Joesph E. Schubert, 788 North Jefferson, Suite 900, Milwaukee, WI 53202.

Defendant Angel R Suarez in court with attorney Joseph Edward Schubert.  Defendant Angel R Suarez in custody.  Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #14CF3977 that are attached to the complaint.  Sworn for the state:Derek Kitts-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 07.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
Court ordered defendant to be monitored by Drug Testing
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Dorothy R; Brett D;  Co-Defendant Alexis Martinez
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Angel R Suarez in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Defendant Angel R Suarez in custody.  
David A. Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge McAdams, Branch 7.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Defendant pleads Not Guilty as to Count 5 ( Misdemeanor).
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
